channel.title: Help Us Test the New Auxy Version!
channel.description:
We are almost ready to ship the next Auxy version, which adds some exciting new features and improvements. We have been testing this version with our beta testers, but before we release it to everyone in the App Store, we want some more people to install it and verify that everything works as expected.
### Here is how you can help: 1. **Backup all your projects** by copying the iCloud/Auxy folder to some other directory, just in case anything goes wrong. 2. Download the new version via TestFlight: https://testflight.apple.com/join/fZMFG11Z 3. Use the new version as usual and let us know in the comments if you find anything that is broken or just hard to understand!
Thanks!

item.title: Help Us Test the New Auxy Version!
item.dc:creator: tornait
item.description:
Depends on which has the beta version. If they both have the beta version, I think project sharing will still be available, haven’t tested it out myself. However, I think the main reason is the import feature for the beta. That’ll be the new way to transfer files between devices from now on, I think.

In other words… say goodbye to project sharing as you know it— for now, at least.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Us Test the New Auxy Version!
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
What's New in 5.4 - Ableton Live Export and Improved Reliability Official Announcements
This update introduces Ableton Live export—the perfect feature for Ableton users who use Auxy as a sketch pad for new tracks. It also brings some important changes to how projects and samples are stored and managed in the app. New Features Projects can now be exported as Ableton Live sets with instruments rendered as separate audio and MIDI tracks Projects and samples are now stored in the app for improved performance and reliability Projects and samples can now be easily imported and exported…

Read full topic

item.title: Help Us Test the New Auxy Version!
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
The process is the same, but when you tried collaborating with imported samples it was kind of a nightmare. This update simplified that QUITE a bit! Now samples are tied to a single file and you don’t need to jerk around with downloading samples off Google Drive or Dropbox, replicating the folder structure etc etc. Single file export, single file import.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Us Test the New Auxy Version!
item.dc:creator: tornait
item.description:
https://app.auxy.co/projects/LrbJvgTFKUZ-BKH-kIF7dQ==

Forgive the groove. But there is exactly one exterior sample in this project. If it shows up with the name “James”, then this will be proof of the sample export working. If the sample does not show up, let it be known in the replies so Len can find out.

Again, posting this here for the sake of sample sharing, if it does indeed work correctly, let it be known publicly.

( janitors, if this post is out of line some how, feel free to remove it, although I hope someone downloads the project and sees the sample work

Read full topic
